CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function unique_name_501 is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. This is due to the fact that the function directly inserts user-controlled data (`html`) into the HTML document without properly sanitizing it first. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting malicious scripts into `html`, which would then be executed when the page is rendered.
